title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Maine's Attorney General

C. U.S. Attorney for Maine

D. The FBI

---

2. The U.S. declined to impose sanctions -- on which pipeline?

A. Colonial

B. Keystone XL

C. Nord Stream 2

D. Meerschaum

---

3. Microsoft is pulling the plug on a venerable application. Which?

A. Excel

B. Outlook

C. Windows

D. Internet Explorer

---

4. President Biden, an avowed "car guy," test drove a new vehicle. What was it?

A. The Army's next generation M3 Abrams tank

B. The new electric Ford F-150 Lightning

C. Tesla's wedge-like Cybertruck

D. Chrysler's Delaware, a planned subcompact

---

5. Zhang Yiming will step down as CEO -- of which Chinese tech company?

A. Alibaba

B. Ant Group

C. ByteDance

D. Tencent

---

6. Celebrity-backed Swedish oat-milk maker Oatly Group AB went public -- under what ticker symbol?

A. OATLY

B. OTLY

C. OTLE

D. OPRAH

---

7. U.S. distillers breathed a sigh of relief. Why?

A. Europe postponed a 50% tariff on American whiskey.

B. Grain futures halted their pandemic-era climb.

C. A new study linked marijuana to hair loss.

D. Scotch exports were halted by a barrel fungus.

---

8. Which golfer, in capturing the British Masters, won for the first time in 478 European Tour events?

A. Edward Staid

B. Richard Bland

C. Lucinda Dull

D. Hyacinth Boring

---

9. A gray whale, thought extinct in the Atlantic, turned up in the Mediterranean. What did scientists name it?

A. Wally

B. Ernie

C. Lucy

D. Hazel

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. C

3. D

4. B

5. C

6. B

7. A

8. B

9. A
